summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York residence and private island in the Virgin Islands. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; devices were seized from his person and his residences. The warrant seeks evidence of his involvement in sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her and her involvement in the subject offenses.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: Signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

persons.name: Kelly Maguire
persons.context: Seized two hard drives (Subject Device-3) from a blue suitcase during the search of Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019.

connections.description: Explicitly identified as co-conspirators in the subject offenses (sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement). The warrant seeks evidence of their communications and joint activities.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI. Two electronic devices (a silver iPad and a black iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private residence in New York City, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices from various locations within the multi-story townhouse.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from multiple structures including the main residence, pool house, sheds, beach house, and cabanas.

events.title: Warrant issued for forensic search of devices
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued a search warrant authorizing the forensic examination of the 62 seized devices for evidence related to specified federal crimes.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Jeffrey Epstein's private island, approximately 75 acres off St. Thomas)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were subject to the search warrant: 2 from Epstein's arrest, 33 from his New York home, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.
The search is for evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (ยง 2422), enticement (ยง 2423), and conspiracy (ยง 371).

The warrant authorizes a search for specific categories of evidence, including communications with co-conspirators, financial records, travel documents, and sexually suggestive photographs of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger.
The devices were seized over a period from July to August 2019, but the warrant for their forensic examination was not issued until June 2020, nearly a year later.
